name: Montgomery's pair correlation conjecture
rephrased: The zeros of the Riemann zeta function (when normalized to have a unit average spacing) tend to behave statistically like the eigenvalues of a random Hermitian matrix from the Gaussian Unitary Ensemble (GUE).
implication_form: If the zeros of the Riemann zeta function are normalized to have unit average spacing, then their two-point correlation function (pair correlation) approaches the sine-squared function correlation function of GUE eigenvalues as the height along the critical line goes to infinity.
explained: Montgomery's pair correlation conjecture states that the distribution of the zeros of the Riemann zeta function on the critical line, when scaled, has a specific statistical correlation function. It suggests that the pair correlation function for these zeros is the same as that for the eigenvalues of a random Hermitian matrix in the Gaussian Unitary Ensemble (GUE). This implies a "repulsion" effect, where zeros are not found clumped together but are, on average, spaced out from each other.
terms: zeros of the Riemann zeta function
random matrix theory (specifically the Gaussian Unitary Ensemble or GUE)
